result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. ...
4)Defendant must submit to random drug and alcohol testing within 3 hours of hte request of the DA and pay all fees associated with testing.....
5)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
7) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morgan L. Wilbur

records.addlTxt: 02:43 PM Defendant Morgan L. Wilbur appeared by zoom technology by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Morgan previously appeared and plead not guilty.  State has reviewed this matter with Ms. Wilbur and has a signed DAGPA on Court's dashboard.  Defendant confirms the agreement and confirms her signature.  The agreement is for 1 year and if comply with the agreement the State will dismiss the charge.  If you fail to adhere to the agreement, you could be revoked and sentenced up to the maximum.  Court advises defendant of charge of disorderly conduct/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Court advises of right to appear personally.  Ms. Wilbur does not object to conducting this hearing in this fashion.  Defendant understands the right to attorney and waives her right to an attorney.  Court finds you knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waive your rights.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court defers acceptance of the DAGP contract for 1 year and signs the contract.
Proposed Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement
Status conference on April 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:27 PM Defendant Morgan L. Wilbur appeared by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and rights.  NGP entered.  Defendant confirms her address on file.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
